page.title: 07KING GEORGE V1 PARK
page.content: What is now King George V1 park used to be the gardens of Sir Moses Montefiore's mansion called East Cliff Lodge.When he bought the mansion and grounds covering some 24 acres in 1831 it only cost him Â£5,500!It is made of brick with a stucco finish and slated roof in the Gothic style with castellated towers.In the gardens is an Italianate conservatory of architectural and historic interest. Built in the 18th century it is a delicate cast and wrought iron structure with small scalloped panes and an iron entrance porch.It was reopened after restoration in 1981.The park is now used for walking the dog,picnics and playing in the area with climbing frames,swings and a slide.The gardens have seats and a kiosk for refreshments.The park overlooks the Channel-France if fine!
